content.description: Definitely another adventure-type climb. A few harder moves, punctuated by easy 5.3-5.5 climbing. Begin on steep slab and climb past two bolts. Utilizing large blocks/flakes, climb through easy (5.4) terrain for next three bolts. Route gets steeper for last 15 feet on clean granite. The holds are there but you gotta find them. 70 feet, 7 bolts plus anchors.
content.location: Route is between Ghost Train and A Loco Motive.

content.description: Fun adventure climbing on clean granite makes this a must do for anyone looking to experience 550 climbing in all its beauty. The route takes 9 bolts up clean slab climbing into a small overhang that puts you on the pitch one ledge with a two bolt anchor(no rings). From there 5 bolts lead out onto another clean slab with nice exposure to ring anchors at the top. A 60m rope will touch base if rappelling in or to pull ropes. If setting a top rope from the rings use a redirect on the first pitch anchors. The route can also be lead in one long pitch with one long runner at pitch one anchors 15 draws and anchor material.
content.location: Approach via area discription. Coming in the back way is especially scenic as you arrive at the top and rappel in.

content.description: Located about 100 feet to climber’s right of Ghost Train. Route follows a cool arete to an open book bulge. Pull the somewhat cryptic crux and easier climbing up a slab to ring anchors.
content.location: 100 feet to right of Ghost Train

content.description: Obscure but tall for the area this is a new crag with wonderful views and adventurous climbing.
